etymology.description: Phonetic 肰 (rán) + Semantic 火 (huǒ, "fire") = to burn -> 肉 (ròu, "meat") components stylistically transformed as 夕 with added stroke
etymology.interpretation: The character 然(rán) involves the concept of burning, indicated by the fire radical. The top component, originally representing meat, has evolved in shape to resemble 夕 in its modern form, modified by an additional stroke. This reflects its evolution from depicting burning meat to its current uses implying correctness or likeness.

examples.chinese: 你这么做才是然的(你這麼做才是然的)，值得称赞(值得稱讚)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zhème zuò cái shì rán de, zhídé chēngzàn.
examples.english: The way you do it is correct, and it deserves praise.

examples.chinese: 按照说明操作(按照說明操作)，结果就会然(結果就會然)。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào shuōmíng cāozuò, jiéguǒ jiù huì rán.
examples.english: If you operate according to the instructions, the result will be just so.
